file_content.text: Back already, Captain? Help me and Corso finish this Roba steak. Don't let this fine cut of meat go to waste.
I wish I could see the look on Skavak's face when he sees you in that separatist base.
I've got good news and great news, Captain. We cracked the separatist computer files and found Skavak.
Viidu, you promised you wouldn't get so excited. It isn't good for your heart.
Sorry, sweetheart. But this is going to be great. Skavak won't even see us coming! Hah!
Does Skavak still have my starship?
Where's my ship?
Your ship and the blasters. Great, huh? We'll get back everything he stole all at once.
Then there's no time to waste.
Easy there, Captain. We've got some details to sort out first.
I want Skavak to see my face before he dies.
I'll kill him slow.
Before you fry him, make sure he knows I sent you.
Skavak is taking the blasters to the separatist base. Those wackos built their headquarters inside an old volcano. Crazy, huh?
What do you expect from foaming-at-the-mouth murderers? I wish that volcano would blow its top.
Skavak's delivering the blasters to a psycho named Dareg at the base. You need to get there first.
When Skavak shows up, you can ambush him, grab your ship and fly back here. Easy, huh?
"Easy" isn't the first word that comes to mind.
Try suicidal.
Well, what if I sent along a little help?
I'll make it look that way.
Make that two heroes. I'm not sending you alone.
I won't be happy until Skavak and all his separatist friends are dead.
Not an ambush--a slaughter.
That makes two of us.
Take Corso with you, Captain. The kid knows more about blasters and vibroblades than anybody I've met.
I owe Skavak payback for taking Torchy. That was lower than low.
It'll be nice to have some backup out there.
Come on, then.
Glad you think so.
Can you keep your cool with the separatists?
I don't know about this.
Don't worry about me.
I've never had a sidekick before.
My very own lackey.
Yeah? Me neither.
Then it's a deal. You two head for the separatist base, kill Dareg and ambush Skavak when he shows up.
I've got a bottle of Chandrilan brandy to open when you get back.
I'm just looking forward to getting back into space.
All I want is my ship.
You've got a deal.
When I'm done with Skavak, there won't be anything left to bury.
Skavak dies today.
I'd wish you two "good luck," but I don't want to jinx anything. Just come back in one piece.
Easy does it. I've got a storage unit here to stabilize the canister so it doesn't blow. There we go....
I think I'll just stand way over here.
It could still blow.
It's completely stable, now. I can't wait to let Rogun know the good news.
Take it easy.
Don't worry. This canister is safer than a Senator's daughter in a room full of Jedi.
This may be the craziest thing I've ever done.
That was a real thrill.
I'll bet you get a lot of free drinks at the cantina telling this tale.
Getting Trymbo's chemicals saved our necks, Captain. Rogun will be too busy selling them to think about the blasters.
The separatists sure seemed interested in getting that canister.
The bad guys wanted this.
Maybe we should let them have some. They might blow themselves up.
That Trymbo guy was a few freighters short of a convoy.
That scientist was crazy.
I know what you mean. Every time I talk to him, he thinks I'm his great-grandfather who crashed into a black hole.
I deserve hazard pay.
Sure, why not? I like you, kid. I really do.
Buy yourself something fancy to kill Skavak with.
Like I said, this job pays well. Take these with my highest compliments.
The slicer kit should be done with those separatist files by the time you get back.
We'll know where to find Skavak soon, but until then, I've got a special job that only you can do.
Until I get my ship back, my schedule's pretty open.
Let's hear it.
I have an exciting opportunity for us to all stay alive.
Haven't I done enough for you already?
More work?
What, you've got some pressing engagement? Our lives are on the line!
Not interested.
I wouldn't be asking if it wasn't life-and-death.
I need you to keep Rogun the Butcher off our backs. Syreena stalled him earlier, but it's not enough.
We need to distract Rogun by giving him something he really wants--a canister of some special chemicals from a nearby village.
The "Big Boom Run"? Are you kidding, boss? I can see it making Rogun's day, but it's blasted risky.
How will this "Big Boom Run" make Rogun happy?
Explain yourselves.
It will make him a lot of money from the Republic and kill a lot of separatists. It's a win-win scenario.
I like risky.
You don't understand. Folks lose their arms and legs on this job. Heads, too.
All I care about is finding Skavak and getting back what's mine.
I just want my ship.
If we don't get Rogun off our backs, you won't get the chance to do that. Hear me out.
There's a loopy scientist with a chemical that can supercharge artillery cannons--makes them do more damage.
But it's less stable than a drunk savrip on a speeder bike. Handle it wrong, and suddenly you're little chunks of ex-captain.
Sure it's tricky, but you've got the skill to get it here. Did I mention this run pays unbelievably well?
Just how "unbelievably well" are we talking about?
Credits, you say?
You do this and you can buy some nice upgrades for your starship when you finally get it back.
Well, in that case....
Fantastic. I won't even haggle down on your fee. That's how much I respect you.
Why should I bother risking my neck on this?
I'm not convinced.
Because you're the best of the best, and you'll make a ton of credits. More importantly, you'll keep Rogun off our backs.
Trymbo is the scientist's name. Got a place in Oradam village. I'll let him know you're coming.
Oradam is Republic-friendly, but I hear separatists are sniffing around the area. Keep your eyes open.
I can't believe I'm actually doing this.
This is crazy.
I'll make this quick.
I have other business to take care of first.
I'll go in a while.
What could be more important than keeping Rogun the Butcher happy?
Oradam isn't far. Maybe we'll have decrypted those separatist files by the time you get back.
See me before you make that run, Captain. We should talk.
You left a big mess in my warehouse. Syreena says it was Bracco's fault, but now I've got a serious morale problem.
Your men were pushing Syreena around because they think you're weak.
You already had that.
I appreciate that, but sometimes frying guys is the worst thing you can do.
Send a cleanup crew to scrape Bracco off the floor and let's move on.
Bracco asked for it.
My people have better things to do than scrub up fried morons. That stuff is bad for business.
I don't apologize.
The last thing I need is some loose cannon blowing holes in my employees.
I hope you didn't come back from Mannett Point empty-handed, Captain.
How could you ever doubt I'd come through?
Show me some confidence.
Doubt is the boss's middle name.
Finally! I thought you'd never get back. Tell me you got those separatist files!
Those separatists never knew what hit them.
Yes, and I had a blast.
I hate missing all the fun. Next time, I want to go.
Here are the files.
See, boss? I told you the captain would come through.
Some of your goons just went after your girl, Viidu.
I got them and saved Syreena.
Word must be getting out we're in trouble. The warehouse boys smell blood in the water.
Want me to knuckle down on the staff, boss?
Just keep an eye on them. If those idiots make another move against me, we'll clean house.
You did good, Captain. Corso found us a terrific little slicer kit, so we're ready to decrypt that data.
What are you hanging around here for? You need to raid that separatist computer on Mannett Point.
Reki told me he gave you a way into the separatists' hideout. Said something about a secret entrance?
Always wondered how Reki could steal so much from Mannett Point and not get caught.
You should see all the women Reki surrounds himself with.
Reki has quite a fan club.
That guy always manages to find the bright side of a bad deal. We should all be so lucky.
Tell me about Mannett Point.
It used to be a great place to fish, drink and meet women. Now it's a separatist hideout.
Reki said the separatist files are encrypted--thought you could help.
I need special equipment.
Encrypted files are the least of our problems, believe me.
Getting onto Mannett Point will be extra tricky. For one thing, you have to swim there.
When the separatists invaded, they blew up the only bridge leading onto the island. Turned it into their private resort.
You'll be walking into the rancor's den, Captain.
Maybe I'll get lucky and find Skavak wandering around.
Skavak could be there.
I doubt he'll be that easy to find--and I don't recommend asking for him door-to-door.
Sounds like a great time.
Don't get cocky. That place is crawling with people who'd like to blast that grin off your face.
When I get done there, it'll be a boneyard.
I eat rancors for breakfast.
That'll be interesting, since you'll be outnumbered a hundred to one.
If you download the separatist computer files onto this datapad and bring it back here, we'll handle the rest.
I'm sending Corso to rattle a data slicer who owes me. He'll cough up something to unscramble the separatist files.
I'd rather go with you, Captain. My vibroblade's pretty good for chopping separatists off at the knees. I call it "Hewie."
Do you name all your weapons, Corso?
"Hewie"?
Just my favorites. This here's a Merr-Sonn Munitions, model 401. It'll ruin a separatist's day mighty quick.
There's no substitute for a good blaster at your side.
Let's go in shooting.
I wish Torchy could be here for this....
I don't need your help, farm boy.
Not looking for a sidekick.
Who said anything about help? I just want to kill some separatists.
Forget about the separatists, Corso. I want that slicer kit here before the captain comes back.
I'm on it, boss. Good luck at Mannett Point, Captain.
Last thing I need is Corso turning "one man army" out there. Kid will just get himself killed for nothing.
Separatists wiped out his family a couple of years ago. Corso took it personal.
I don't blame him for wanting revenge.
I'd feel the same way.
Mixing personal grudges and business is like dropping a thermal detonator into a fuel dump.
How did Corso wind up working for you?
Is that why he's here?
He started as warehouse labor, but he took to fighting like a Firaxan shark to water.
I bet he cries himself to sleep every night.
Kid needs to toughen up.
I wouldn't say that to his face if I were you. For a lighthearted guy, Corso takes his family very seriously.
Viidu, there's someone named Rogun calling on the holo. He sounds upset.
Oh, that's all I need! Stall him for me, sweetheart.
What do you want me to say?
I don't know--be charming and beautiful! Come on, Captain, get us that lead on Skavak. Hurry.
You do what you do best, fat man: sit there and sweat.
Sit tight, chubby.
Don't worry.
Off to war.
Remember the plan: Disrupt Mannett Point's power relays, get inside Reki's old home and use those schematics to enter the separatist base.
When you're in, slice into the separatist computer and download everything onto my datapad. Good luck.
Boss, quit acting like that's your last meal. Rogun the Butcher isn't gonna kill you.
Good to see you again, Corso.
Hello, Corso.
Likewise. Looking forward to working together, Captain.
Stinking right, he won't.
Until I've recovered those stolen blasters, I'll eat and drink like there's no tomorrow.
You planning to eat and drink yourself to death, fat man?
You're losing it, Viidu.
I'm being practical. If things don't work out, at least I won't die on an empty stomach.
I hear things went well for you in Talloran. It takes nerve to squeeze credits out of starving people.
Nice work in Talloran. We're getting somewhere with this hunt for Skavak.
Don't take too long delivering that kit. Some of the contents are perishable. You'll find Reki at his hideout in Talloran.
The blasters Skavak stole in your ship belonged to Rogun the Butcher. As employers go, he's not the most forgiving.
I can't imagine anything worse than losing my ship.
What do I care?
How about getting fed to a nest of womp rats one toe at a time?
My sympathies.
Feel sorry for yourself. I'm working for him, but you're working for me. He'll blame us equally for this mess.
Should I be terrified just because he calls himself "the Butcher"?
Ooh, scary.
He's killed enough people to fill a convoy of bulk freighters, and now we've crossed him.
Rogun bought those blasters to protect his business from separatists. When he finds out what's happened, guess who dies first?
Just tell Rogun that Skavak stole the blasters.
So tell him the truth.
The only reason we're alive is because Rogun doesn't know anything's wrong. Let's keep it that way.
Maybe we should run for it while we still can.
Retreat is an option.
And go where? Rogun the Butcher isn't a local problem. His reach extends all over this galaxy.
I'll fry him if he tries.
Corso says you're talented with a blaster, but that doesn't mean you're ready to take on Rogun.
The only way we're getting out of this alive is finding Skavak, your ship and those stolen blasters.
I'll put all my knowledge and contacts at your disposal, but we'll still be hunting for a pebble in an asteroid field.
Those aren't the worst odds I've ever faced.
Been there, done that.
Either you've led a very interesting life or you're the most overconfident space-jockey in the galaxy.
Separatists aren't so tough.
Good, 'cause you'll probably have to kill a lot of separatists to find Skavak.
You'd better get to work looking, tubby.
You owe me, fatso.
If you want your ship back, you'll have to get your hands dirty, too--and don't call me "tubby."
I've got an idea where to start looking for Skavak. There's a guy named Reki who's an expert on separatists.
Problem is, Reki's stuck behind a Republic blockade. Troops have his village surrounded while they "contain" the separatists there.
How did the separatists manage to take over a whole town?
Separatists control a village?
Separatists have sympathizers in every village, helping them hold towns they take over. Traitors.
There must be somebody else with knowledge of the separatists.
Who else can we talk to?
Reki's the only person I trust to give us solid information.
I'll bust Reki out of that village. Can't be that hard.
Let's rescue him.
Forget about a rescue mission. We don't have time.
I'm friendly with the Republic commander in charge of the blockade. I can get you in and out of the village.
But you'll have to earn that free pass by taking out a few separatists to prove your loyalty. You up for that?
What am I gonna prove by shooting separatists?
A loyalty test?
That you're not one of them. The Republic isn't letting any separatist sympathizers out of that place.
I won't shoot anybody unless they attack me first.
I'm not a killer.
I don't think that's gonna be a problem with the separatists.
I'd kill those scum just for kicks.
It'll be my pleasure.
Good. One less detail to worry about.
Reki's village is running out of basic supplies thanks to the Republic blockade. Things are getting desperate in there.
I'll pull together a survival kit. You smuggle it to Reki, and he'll tell you a way to find Skavak.
What exactly is in this survival kit?
Survival kit?
Food, water and death sticks. Life's essentials.
How much is this survival kit worth?
Is the kit valuable?
In Reki's village, it'll be priceless. Guard it with your life.
This better end with me getting my ship back, Viidu.
I'll do this for my ship.
You'll get your ship, I'll get Rogun the Butcher's blasters and Skavak will get what's coming to him.
Understood.
If anyone asks, I'm out killing separatists.
Time for some carnage.
Reki's at a hideout in Talloran village. I'll send a message so he knows you're coming.
Good luck, Captain. I'll save a little Tarisian wine for when you get back.
Welcome, Captain! I'm Viidu. Corso told me we've had a rough day. How about a drink to wash away our worries?
I have a four-hundred-year-old bottle of Tarisian wine. Bought it at a private auction back on Coruscant. Amazing stuff.
Vintage Tarisian wine must have cost you a fortune.
You have expensive tastes.
This bottle's probably worth more than the fort, but who cares? Life is short and getting shorter by the minute.
Sure, if you're buying.
That's the spirit! Live for the moment and enjoy life. You never know when it's all going to end.
I'm not here to drink with you, pal.
I'm in no mood to be social.
Ah well. You're missing out. This is great stuff, and harder to find than a Hutt on a diet.
Here's a toast to my favorite things... the best collection of art works and exotic beverages in the whole system.
And here's to the stupid separatists who destroyed it all. Between them and that backstabber Skavak, I am thoroughly ruined!
What do Skavak and the separatists have against you? You owe them money, or something?
What's their deal?
I'm rich and they're not. Separatists live to sabotage and steal from good businessmen like me.
Ruined? How so?
Before the separatists came along I had this world on a string, Captain.
You don't look so bad-off to me.
I'm sure you'll survive.
Can't you smell this place? It's a cesspool! Oh, how I've fallen.
People called me "The King of Cargo." I greased the wheels of commerce and only asked a reasonable percentage.
Now I hide in this fort because separatists hate rich people. I can't believe Skavak's with those scum!
Enough about you. What about me? Skavak stole my ship.
He has my ship.
You've got bigger problems than being marooned on Ord Mantell.
Sounds like you and Skavak have a history.
How well did you know him?
I'd known him long enough that I thought he was a friend. Turns out he'll be the death of me.
Quit whining.
You don't really understand what's going on here, do you? This is serious end-of-the-world business.
This war has forced me to work for some not-so-nice people. Now you're a part of that.
I'm conducting important business here. Make an appointment, all right?
